title: The Bachelorette's Angie Kent will hand out a yellow rose to a suitor who will score a 24-hour date
text:
While The Bachelorette is synonymous with red roses, this year's season will feature a twist.

According to a report by Woman's Day magazine on Monday, Angie Kent will also be handing out yellow roses.

The yellow rose will enable a lucky suitor to enjoy a 24-hour date with the 29-year-old Bachelorette.

Surprise: The Bachelorette's Angie Kent (pictured) is set to hand out a yellow flower to a lucky suitor who will score a 24-hour date with her, it was reported on Monday

And apparently the boys don't have to wait too long before a yellow rose comes their way.

'At the first cocktail party, Angie hands out a yellow rose to the guy who made the best first impression,' a source told Woman's Day.

'They go glamping overnight at a farm.'

Going for gold: 'At the first cocktail party, Angie hands out a yellow rose to the guy who made the best first impression,' a source told Woman's Day

But it apparently wasn't long before their date was interrupted by the other jealous suitors, who stormed the farm early the next day.

In an interview with NW magazine on Monday, Angie revealed she had found love, confessing she was 'very, very happy'.

And she admitted she didn't have a particular type, claiming she is 'attracted to someone's smile and their spirit'.

Date night: 'They go glamping overnight at a farm' the source claimed

She confessed she also has a soft spot for men who are 'dorky', 'quirky' and 'super-funny'.

'I like someone who is just a really good listener and caring, and someone who can put up with my weird and wacky ways,' she added.

'I want someone who's a weirdo too - life's gotta be exciting.'
description: While The Bachelorette is synonymous with red roses, this year's season will feature a twist.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
